metadata.title: CVE-2022-48564 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
read_ints in plistlib.py in Python through 3.9.1 is vulnerable to apotential DoS attack via CPU and RAM exhaustion when processing malformedApple Property List files in binary format.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm18
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm18
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm18
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm18
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm18
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm18
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm18
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm18
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm18').
python3.4 package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
